q: In C++, which of the following is a valid type of inheritance?

What is the output of the following C++ code:

#include<iostream>
using namespace std;


class Base {
    public:
    Base(){
        cout << "Base called "<< endl;
    }
};

class Base1{
    public:
    Base1(){
        cout << "Base1 called"<< endl;
    }
};

class Derived: public Base, public Base1{
    public:
    Derived(){
        cout << "Derived called" << endl; 
    }
};

int main(){
    Derived d ;
    return 0;
}

Output 

  1. Base called
Base1 called

     

  2. Derived called
Base1 called 
Base called

     

  3. Base called
Base1 called
Derived called

     

  4. Base called
Derived Called
In C++, if class C is derived from class B that is derived from class A through public inheritance, then which of the following data can be accessed by class C?

a.option: Protected and Private data of B
Protected and Public data of A
Protected and Private data of A and B
Protected data of A and B
